concept.title: The Physical Channel
concept.shortdesc: The physical channel defines the interface between the logical device and the physical device. It is an instance of a class derived from DBase.

conbody.p: It is analogous to the logical channel. Unlike the logical channel, which must be derived from DLogicalChannelBase, or from DLogicalChannel, and must conform to a globally defined interface, the physical channel interface is determined only by the LDD with which it is used. This means that we cannot make any general recommendation as to the structure, and detailed behaviour of the physical channel.
However, a physical channel is used by the Simple Example Device Driver, and is a good example of how a physical channel is implemented.
